name: Trigonometry - Stacking triangles
description: This tutorial will help you learn how to get the coordinates of the vertex of a triangle with a non-unit hypotenuse from its angle.

pages.textBefore: To get the position of a node whose parent is a child of another node, you need to create a second triangle at the vertex of the first one.
pages.textAfter: If the node at (x1, y1) has the coordinates (r1*cosΘ1, r1*sinΘ1). The second child's position is (x1+x2, y1+y2) so it has the coordinates (r1*cosΘ1 + r2*cosΘ2, r1*sinΘ1 + r2*sinΘ2)
